column5: Way to slime the new boat. Always nice to get some early Salmon fishing in. Don't get stuck riggin all year with that new boat of yers. It's addicting catching large fish that pull your line.
Ders da report I was waiting for nice fish guys enjoy the new boat.
Thanks for the great report and pics Joey. Looks like you and Paul did a great job for the first time out fishing in the new boat.
Must be the Lund cant be Paul gotta love the rockets
Nice goin' guys!
Man Joey what a way to break in the new boat!  Sweet fish for sure!
Wow....what a great day out on the water guys!!!.....nice Salmon!!
Attagrrl, joey.  Those are fabulous salmon.  Imagine if they had actually hit in pairs, youse guys would have been busy.
Those are some solid salmon...way to go...seeing salmon reports gets me excited and anxious....2 months and i get to fish for them!
Great report and pics
Been wondering what you two have been up to with your new ride.  Glad to see you get some fish slime in it.  What is your opinion of the Verado?
Theirs one thing I like to know about the Verado, Is how much fuel is it suppose to use.  I thinks that the gauge is broken.

Well our Lund got her first slime today  Headed down to Oakville to arrive around 7:30 a.m.  Nice on shore, a tad cold out on the water, but we were prepared.  10 a.m. Paul sees a school of baitfish on the fishfinder and moments later it was fish on.  First fish to slime the boat.      We almost got a double header.  As soon as this picture was taken the next line went off.  My turn up.    Set all the lines out again and trolled back through the same bait fish pile and whamo.  This nice 33 incher and entry for Joey's Jiggers' team    Same thing happened.  As Paul was reviving this fish, off goes another line, my turn again.  This one gave a great fight and did some acrobatics for us.  It was just shy of the 33 incher Paul had just released but I think it's girth was a bit bigger.     So it was a great day to be out there and nice to christen the boat  Boat Ramp Bozo's Episode  Funny thing happened in the parking lot.  A guy came down with an extended van with no rear windows towing a zodiak.  He came and chatted with me and said he was a scuba diver but was going to give fishing a try.  Never had and was pretty ill prepared.  Had no riggers or anything but was going to Salmon fish out deep     So as we're packing up we hear a nice crunch and notice that as he was backing up the trailer basically jacknifed and was jammed almost under the van's bumper.  Then he got out and looked, got back in and continued to back up *Crunch Crunch*.  So he gets out and looks and I told him to drive forward and around the parking lot to start again.  He says he's afraid to do that cause he might hit something.  Said he thought the trailer would just go straight back and follow the van backwards     He finally listens and then pulls around to start the launch again and then gets out and asks Paul if he can help him.  Paul goes over and looks and the whole trailer is bent and the bumper has a big dent in it.  He tells the guy that he's going to have problems even getting the trailer to travel safely now.  The guy just says "Oh well, I'll just call my bud and he'll come down and help me, he's just around the corner."  So he was still there waiting as we left.  We wished him luck and I said to Paul "That is just an accident waiting to happen now."     Hope it turns out well for him  Cheers,  Joey
Wow!!! Great fish there Joey!!  Congrats on the first slime in the boat...the first of many many fish I'm sure.
Some nice fish, congrats on the first slime in the boat!  That was a great boat launch bozo story. I'm thinking about pulling up a lawn chair quite a bit this summer at the launch
That's why us divers spend so much time under the water. We do less damage that way.  JF
Congrats on the fist fish i am sure of many!!
Nice way to initiate the new boat.
Hunph! One of those about equals my total catch weight for a season's wading for bass.  JF
Nice fish Joey you and Paul did good on sliming the boat how deep where you fishing?  Rob

Hey Hey Hey!!!... excellent way to slime the new boat!!!... Congratulations to you and Paul!!!  I't looks like that new boat is going to be a real fish magnet!!!  Great Bozo story!!!  ... kinda reminds me of the story about the guy that puts his motor home on cruise control and goes to the back to make himself a sandwich... then wonders why it crashed!
Nice way to test out the new boat.  I have seen that done at the launch ramp maybe it was the same guy.
Between 150 to 200 feet.  Water temp rose a couple degrees as the day went on too.
You edit too fast Hosette!
Who hasn't jackknifed a trailer or two in their day??? lol.  Nice fish Joey.  Enjoy that new toy.
Nice going eh!  a fresh coat of salmo slime..  soon to be mixed with some good skiii slime..  Now you're talking!!  Thanks! HD
Thats the way to do it.The best slime has to be salmon slime.Congrats on a great day with the new boat. Dan
Awesome Fishing.  maybe if he runs outta air he might be doing the world a favor opps

Way to go Paul and Joey! You surely did have a great day out there. Very nice fish indeed. Great pics too!  I printed this thread out for J and she was impressed but wants to know how you'll be able to eat all of that fish.  Looking forward to your next report. Fantastic! I'm really happy for you guys.
Thats a good way to start up, some nice fish 4sure...
Some nice hogs there!  congrats on getting the skunk off that sweet boat.
great job on the first slime for your boat!  Cheers!
SALMON SLIME ! ....Is that not liking cursing the boat to a musky guy.
Talk about slimming a new boat..... man you guys sure got it down to a T Congratulations to both of you Leechman
That's what I was thinking!    I was looking for a fish or 2 with more of a green colour and lots of teeth!      Great report Joey and congrats to you and Paul on the first slime.  VERY NICE!!!
Beautiful looking fish!
Beautiful fish, congrats on christening the new boat (and a beaut too, by the way, saw the other thread announcing your new ride)  Congrats on a great first day...  Mike
